title: mprotect PROT_GROWSDOWN support
body: Needed for fis-gtm to fully function.

comments.body: Rather than asking Microsoft to implement a security hole, why doesn't everyone tell their package maintainers to fix their code? If enough people pester them enough, they'll have no choice but to fix it.
This is also breaking Anaconda's package manager
Please fix it in Windows 10 Fall Creators Update. Error "cannot enable executable stack as shared object requires: Invalid argument" really annoying
And needed by oracle applications, sqlplus, etc.
And OpenCV, widely used by computer vision developers!
This is also an issue with projects that dynamically link to Intel's IPP framework.
CLISP also needs this to run.
